intro: Acianthera glanduligera, commonly known as the glandular acianthera, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant has a terrestrial growth habit and features a slender, branching stem. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped and covered with a fine layer of glandular hairs. Acianthera glanduligera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
